resources.string: Choose a Disease to learn more!
Eight-year-old Fode Dramé, who has trachoma and will receive treatment from a community volunteer to protect him for the rest of the year.

River Blindness is a tropical disease caused by a parasitic worm and transmitted by the bite of the black fly. The fly bite passes worm larvae into your skin, the worms breed and spread around your body, and when they die your immune system causes inflammation, which can blind you if it happens in your eyes.
Juliana, who lost her sight to river blindness as she had no access to treatment, and her six-year-old granddaughter Nahbila, who thanks to annual treatment is now protected from the disease.

Trachoma Starts off as a highly contagious bacterial infection which can be easily treated. If untreated, over time it makes your eyelashes turn inward so with every blink they’re scraping your eyeball. It is unbearably painful and eventually causes blindness.
